title: Cerulean 2016 Tempranillo Rosé Acadia Vineyards Rosé (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Pale salmon in color, this leads with light strawberry and spice aromas and dry, nicely woven fruit flavors. Orange rind notes linger on the finish. It provides a lot of intrigue and enjoyment.

title: Clos Troteligotte 2017 K-Or Malbec (Cahors)
description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is full of open berry flavors, with a crisp edge and good acidity. It offers tannins from the structured fruit as well as a crisp, juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta do Cardo Reserva Caladoc Rosé (Beira Interior)
description: A really pale rosé, this comes from an experimental vineyard of the rare Caladoc grape. It offers plenty of berry flavors along with a caramel edge, zesty texture and acidity. Drink now.

title: Couleurs d'Aquitaine 2015 Epoque Collection Terroir Red (Bergerac)
description: One of a range of wines from different winemaking areas of Aquitaine (the region centered on Bordeaux), this is a red-fruit-flavored, oak-aged wine. It is soft and generous, with poised tannins and acidity. The core of dryness will soften and broaden into a smooth wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: D'Arenberg 2015 The Stump Jump Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This starts shy in comparison to the typical ripe, brashness of South Aussie Shiraz. With time in glass, however, it reveals attractive red fruit notes of tart cherry and raspberry, with vanilla and savory spice. The palate shows tart, almost mouthpuckering red fruit, with a medium body, light, chalky tannins and a slightly soapy finish.

title: Domaine de Mirail 2016 Les Mirlandes Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Lightly perfumed, this stalky blend comes from the northeast of the Côtes de Gascogne region. Acidity and bright black fruits are the hallmarks of a wine that is fruity, crisp and ready to drink.

title: Dominio IV 2013 Spellbound Red (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: This blend of 56% Syrah, 39% Tempranillo and 5% Petit Verdot overcomes a slightly sweaty nose to bring an interesting, earthy mix of cassis, stem and dried leaf flavors. It's fairly tannic, which amplifies that earthiness, so pair with simple grilled meats.

title: Dusted Valley 2015 Squirrel Tooth Alice Stone Tree Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)
description: Grenache (43%) takes the lead in this wine, followed by Mourvèdre (37%) and Syrah. Unusual aromas of crushed peanuts, savory herb and überripe fruit flavors lead to a peanut shell-like finish. It doesn't all seem in harmony.
designation: Squirrel Tooth Alice Stone Tree Vineyard

title: Eberle 2017 Côtes-Du-Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A darker shade of pink, this blend of 60% Syrah, 37% Grenache and 3% Viognier offers dark raspberry and mulberry on the nose, with a touch of rocky minerality. The palate is clean with rounded plum and turned earth flavors.

title: Fattoria Montecchio 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of baking spice, underbrush and a whiff of dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate evokes black-currant jam, vanilla and star anise alongside supple tannins.

title: Fiuza 2017 Fiuza Cabernet Sauvignon-Touriga Nacional Rosé (Tejo)
description: Two structured grapes inevitably give even a rosé with some tannins. That puts this ripe wine firmly in the food rosé category. Ripe and with plenty of weight, it is ready to drink.

title: Garzón 2016 Reserve Marselan (Uruguay)
description: A concentrated black color and a dense, meaty nose loaded with dark fruit aromas introduce this Marselan. The palate is heavy and soupy, with burnt-tasting black fruit flavors. Its sticky finish tastes of cassis syrup and black pepper.

title: Helix by Reininger 2013 Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine from an up-and-coming vineyard offers fragrant aromas of raspberry, herb and woodspice and well-balanced fruit flavors that taper toward the tart finish. It doesn't seem fully ripe.

title: Hendry 2014 Hendry Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 27% Malbec, 20% Petit Verdot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon 20% Merlot and 13% Cabernet Franc. Together they form a tart tangy streak of acidity that supports leather, cedar and integrated oak. The tannins present as grippy and persistent.

title: Johnson Ridge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cherry, plum, vanilla, cedar and green herb aromas are followed by plump yet restrained fruit and barrel flavors that trail out on the finish. Though aged in only 40% new oak, the wood character seems a bit overbearing.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: There's lots of sweet-seeming spicy oak in this full-bodied wine, yet it also has a good core of ripe blackberry and plum to keep it in balance. Moderate tannins and a mouth-filling texture give it heft.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Pyrène L'Irrésistible Magie Noire Malbec (Comté Tolosan)
description: Although this carries a regional appellation, the wine is effectively Cahors Malbec. It certainly tastes like that with its black tannins, although the texture and weight of the wine are light, with acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink the wine from late 2018.

title: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Heady in honeysuckle aromas, this wine is thick and concentrated in crème brûlée richness, interwoven in baked apple and pear with pronounced oak.

title: McManis 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Smooth and easy to drink, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, with shades of vanilla and nutmeg. The texture is silky, showing a hint of tannin but overall is ripe and juicy.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Rota de Cabral Red (Tejo)
description: Ripe and soft, this is an easygoing blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Castelão. Smooth tannins give it a rounded texture while the red-berry fruits and acidity deliver a crisper aftertaste. It is medium bodied, generous and ready to drink now.

title: Sidewood 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: Incredibly aromatic tones of gooseberry, grape, passionfruit, grass and snow peas erupt from the glass. The palate is tangy and zippy, with mouthwatering acidity and a citrusy, grassy finish. A bold style many will love.

title: Structure 2015 Spire Merlot (Yakima Valley)
description: A distinct green tinge colors the aromas in this blend from Olsen (60%) and Boushey vineyards, with herb and green tea notes more characteristic of Cabernet Franc. The palate brings soft-feeling orange peel and raspberry flavors

title: Tenuta di Arceno 2012 Strada al Sasso Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, tobacco leaf and black plum. The dense palate puts espresso, vanilla, clove and a hint of black cherry alongside taut tannins.

title: Torricino 2016  Greco di Tufo
description: Subtle whiffs of stone fruit and citrus waft out of the glass. The light-bodied tangy palate offers pineapple, citrus and a hint of yellow pear alongside bright acidity.

title: Triacca 2014 La Madonnina La Palaia  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, this straightforward red has subdued aromas reminiscent of tilled soil, mocha and cooking spice. The easygoing palate offers dried black cherry, espresso and a hint of clove alongside round tannins.

title: Triacca 2014 La Madonnina Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward palate evokes black cherry, clove and star anise alongside smooth tannins.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2015 Château Bouscassé Les Jardins  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
description: This smooth, opulent blend of Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng is rich with yellow and white stone fruits along with a touch of spice. It is ready to drink.

title: Villa Matilde 2014 Vigna Caricci White (Falerno del Massico)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, dried aromatic herb and a whiff of petrol follow over to the lean palate along with suggestions of dried pineapple and citrus. A hazelnut note backs up the finish.

title: Amarano 2016 Dulcinea  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: This opens with subtle scents of Spanish broom, yellow pear and a whiff of hazelnut. It's vibrant and linear, with bright acidity that supports yellow apple and lemon.

title: Andis 2016 Bill Dillian Vineyard Sémillon (Amador County)
description: This wine smells earthy and minerally and tastes relatively austere due to firm acidity and not overly ripe flavors. Light to medium in body, it offers good savory, smoky notes and an inviting texture that seems to gain richness with time in the glass.
